newsitem.title: CHINA: China M2 down 2.69 percentage pts yr/yr end-Sept.
newsitem.headline: China M2 down 2.69 percentage pts yr/yr end-Sept.

text.p: China's broad M2 money supply fell by 2.69 percentage points year-on-year to the end of September, the China Securities newspaper said on Monday, quoting central bank governor Dai Xianglong.
Dai said M2 growth was approaching the target of 25 percent annual growth set earlier this year. He did not give M2 growth at end-September of the year-ago period.

MO money supply, or cash in circulation, rose by 11.8 percent year-on-year to the end of September, Dai said. Net currency put into circulation was expected to reach 120 billion yuan for the whole year.

M1, currency in circulation plus current business deposits, rose by 17 percent year-on-year to the end of September, he said, adding that M1 growth was close to the target of 18 percent annual growth.
The newspaper gave no further details.
